title: Understanding the Backstage View
text: The Backstage View in Excel is where you can manage your files and settings. It's accessed by clicking the 'File' tab in the ribbon.

title: Locating Data Analysis Add-ins
text: Once in the Backstage View, look for options related to add-ins or data tools. These are usually found under the 'Options' or 'Add-ins' section.

hintAnswer: display the backstage view, then click "Enable Data Analysis $$add-ins$$: Power Pivot, Power View, and Power Map" under the data area
title: Enabling Data Analysis Add-ins
text: To enable data analysis add-ins, you need to navigate to a specific section in the Backstage View. Which section should you go to?
choices: display the backstage view, then click "Enable Data Analysis $$add-ins$$: Power Pivot, Power View, and Power Map" under the data area
display the backstage view, then click "Enable Data Analysis $$add-ins$$: Power Pivot, Power View, and Power Map" under the power area
display the home tab, then click "Enable Data Analysis"
